meta.description: Sample CPIC guidelines for PharmXD MVP demo
meta.disclaimer: For educational purposes only. Consult healthcare provider for medical decisions.

ultrarapid_metabolizer.implications: Normal clopidogrel metabolism to active metabolite

normal_metabolizer.implications: Normal clopidogrel metabolism to active metabolite

intermediate_metabolizer.recommendation: Alternative antiplatelet therapy if no contraindication (e.g., prasugrel, ticagrelor). If using clopidogrel, be aware of reduced platelet inhibition.
intermediate_metabolizer.implications: Reduced formation of active metabolite; reduced platelet inhibition; increased residual platelet aggregation; increased risk for adverse cardiovascular events

poor_metabolizer.recommendation: Alternative antiplatelet therapy recommended (e.g., prasugrel, ticagrelor)
poor_metabolizer.implications: Significantly reduced formation of active metabolite; significantly reduced platelet inhibition; significantly increased risk for adverse cardiovascular events

guidelines.fda_label: Tests are available to identify patients who are CYP2C19 poor metabolizers. Consider use of another platelet P2Y12 inhibitor in patients identified as CYP2C19 poor metabolizers.

ultrarapid_metabolizer.recommendation: Avoid codeine. Select alternative analgesic (non-tramadol opioid or non-opioid)
ultrarapid_metabolizer.implications: Greatly increased morphine formation leading to higher risk of toxicity

normal_metabolizer.recommendation: Use label-recommended age or weight-specific dosing

intermediate_metabolizer.recommendation: Use label-recommended age or weight-specific dosing. If inadequate response, consider alternative analgesic.

poor_metabolizer.recommendation: Avoid codeine. Select alternative analgesic (non-tramadol opioid or non-opioid)
poor_metabolizer.implications: Greatly reduced morphine formation. Lack of analgesia.

guidelines.fda_label: Some individuals may be ultra-rapid metabolizers because of a specific CYP2D6 genotype. These individuals convert codeine into its active metabolite, morphine, more rapidly and completely than other people. This rapid conversion results in higher than expected serum morphine levels.

normal_function.recommendation: Prescribe desired starting dose and adjust based on patient response

intermediate_function.recommendation: Prescribe a lower dose or consider an alternative statin. Consider routine creatine kinase surveillance.
intermediate_function.implications: Increased myopathy risk with simvastatin (4.5-fold increased risk)

poor_function.recommendation: Prescribe an alternative statin (e.g., pravastatin, rosuvastatin) or if simvastatin necessary, use low dose (â‰¤20 mg/day)
poor_function.implications: High myopathy risk with simvastatin (17-fold increased risk)

guidelines.fda_label: Predisposing factors for myopathy include the SLCO1B1 (c.521T>C) polymorphism.

normal_CYP2C9_normal_VKORC1.recommendation: Use warfarin dosing algorithm. Expected weekly dose: 5-7 mg/day

normal_CYP2C9_sensitive_VKORC1.recommendation: Decrease dose. Expected weekly dose: 3-4 mg/day

IM_CYP2C9_normal_VKORC1.recommendation: Decrease dose. Expected weekly dose: 3-5 mg/day

PM_CYP2C9_sensitive_VKORC1.recommendation: Significantly decrease dose. Expected weekly dose: 0.5-2 mg/day. Consider alternative anticoagulant.

guidelines.fda_label: The patient's CYP2C9 and VKORC1 genotype information, when available, can assist in selection of the initial dose of COUMADIN.

ultrarapid_metabolizer.recommendation: For H. pylori eradication: increase dose by 50-100%. For GERD: standard dose, increase if inadequate response.

poor_metabolizer.recommendation: For chronic therapy (>12 weeks): consider 50% dose reduction. Monitor for adverse effects.
poor_metabolizer.classification: Consider dose reduction for long-term use

guidelines.fda_label: In poor metabolizers, omeprazole plasma concentrations are substantially elevated.
